title: Good Pairing for Modesto Lite Expanded
content: What text typefaces would pair well with Modesto Lite Expanded, if it were used for headings?
author: wwgreaves

comments.content:
Since I assume Modesto Text isn't texty enough for you, I guess Brothers would be even further off. So maybe: [http://www.myfonts.com/search/hypatia/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416010734/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/hypatia/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/hypatia/fonts/")

hhp
What are you designing? We can't make useful suggestions unless we know more about the goals, audience, usage.

Indeed. I was being stupid, sorry.

hhp

I’m designing letterhead for personal and professional correspondence in which the author’s name in Modesto Lite Expanded is used as the header. I’m looking for a highly legible font for the body text that will compliment (or go well with) the header.

[Beaufort® Extended Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416010734/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/shinntype/beaufort_extended_regular/)

Depending on the text size, and the means of printing, you might also consider the Light weight.

Thanks for the suggestion, Nick. Beaufort® Extended Regular or Medium would be a great alternative to Modesto Lite Expanded. Then I could use Beaufort® Regular as the text.

I would like a little more contrast, however.

I’d like a good sans serif text font to pair with Modesto Lite Expanded. I’ve tried Avenir and Neue Haas Grotesk, and I’ll try Hypatia, as suggested above. Further suggestions would be appreciated.
